TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TransferEncoding extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the Content-Transfer-Encoding header information for an e-mail message attachment.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The values in the TransferEncoding enumeration are used with the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.TransferEncoding?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The Content-Transfer-Encoding header specifies the encoding of the associated message body so that it meets SMTP requirements. SMTP requires data for transport to be in 7-bit US-ASCII characters with lines no longer than 1000 characters.
Content-Transfer-Encoding values are described in detail in RFC 2045 Section 6, available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays TransferEncoding used by an attachment.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#21](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.mime.transf_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#21](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.mime.transf_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding Base64 = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Encodes stream-based data. See RFC 2406 Section 6.8.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding EightBit = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The data is in 8-bit characters that may represent international characters with a total line length of no longer than 1000 8-bit characters. For more information about this 8-bit MIME transport extension, see IETF RFC 6152.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding QuotedPrintable = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Encodes data that consists of printable characters in the US-ASCII character set. See RFC 2406 Section 6.7.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding SevenBit = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Used for data that is not encoded. The data is in 7-bit US-ASCII characters with a total line length of no longer than 1000 characters. See RFC2406 Section 2.7.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding Unknown = int32(-1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the transfer encoding is unknown.
